ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good class if you're really interested in intellectual history with a focus on early US history. Not a good introduction to philosophy or intellectual history.

If you wanted to learn about democracy at its idealistic roots, about the way we envisioned the world when we created it, and the underlying ideas that all the politics, infrastructure, and social stuff is built on, this is a phenomenal class. Don't be put-off by the reading list, it's a lot but worth it, and Professor Somos makes even revisiting the people you've read before interesting.
